Name: Public campaign on parental mental health resources.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a public campaign on parental mental health resources
BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

Summary: This bill would require the Mayor’s Office of Community Mental Health to establish and implement a public outreach and education campaign to raise awareness about resources available at the city, state, and federal level addressing mental health challenges faced by parents. The campaign would be required to be available in the designated citywide languages.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subchapter 9 of chapter 1 of title 3 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 3-195 to read as follows:
      � 3-195. Parental mental health outreach and education. The office shall establish and implement an outreach and education campaign to raise awareness about resources available at the city, state, and federal level addressing mental health challenges faced by parents, which shall include, but shall not be limited to, perinatal and postpartum depression, perinatal and postpartum anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder related to childbirth. The materials for such outreach and education campaign shall be made available in the designated citywide languages. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
